com.connectsdk.discovery

Class DiscoveryManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.connectsdk.discovery.DiscoveryManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConnectableDeviceListener, DiscoveryProviderListener, ServiceConfig.ServiceConfigListener

    public class DiscoveryManager
extends Object
implements ConnectableDeviceListener, DiscoveryProviderListener, ServiceConfig.ServiceConfigListener
    ###Overview At the heart of Connect SDK is DiscoveryManager, a multi-protocol service discovery engine with a pluggable architecture. Much of your initial experience with Connect SDK will be with the DiscoveryManager class, as it consolidates discovered service information into ConnectableDevice objects. ###In depth DiscoveryManager supports discovering services of differing protocols by using DiscoveryProviders. Many services are discoverable over [SSDP][0] and are registered to be discovered with the SSDPDiscoveryProvider class. As services are discovered on the network, the DiscoveryProviders will notify DiscoveryManager. DiscoveryManager is capable of attributing multiple services, if applicable, to a single ConnectableDevice instance. Thus, it is possible to have a mixed-mode ConnectableDevice object that is theoretically capable of more functionality than a single service can provide. DiscoveryManager keeps a running list of all discovered devices and maintains a filtered list of devices that have satisfied any of your CapabilityFilters. This filtered list is used by the DevicePicker when presenting the user with a list of devices. Only one instance of the DiscoveryManager should be in memory at a time. To assist with this, DiscoveryManager has static method at sharedManager. Example: DiscoveryManager.init(getApplicationContext()); DiscoveryManager discoveryManager = DiscoveryManager.getInstance(); discoveryManager.addListener(this); discoveryManager.start(); [0]: http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-cai-ssdp-v1-03

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init(Context context)
        Initilizes the Discovery manager with a valid context. This should be done as soon as possible and it should use getApplicationContext() as the Discovery manager could persist longer than the current Activity. DiscoveryManager.init(getApplicationContext());
        Parameters:
        context - a valid context

      • destroy

        public static void destroy()

      • init

        public static void init(Context context,
                        ConnectableDeviceStore connectableDeviceStore)
        Initilizes the Discovery manager with a valid context. This should be done as soon as possible and it should use getApplicationContext() as the Discovery manager could persist longer than the current Activity. This accepts a ConnectableDeviceStore to use instead of the default device store. MyConnectableDeviceStore myDeviceStore = new MyConnectableDeviceStore(); DiscoveryManager.init(getApplicationContext(), myDeviceStore);
        Parameters:
        context - a valid context
        connectableDeviceStore - a device store

      • getInstance

        public static DiscoveryManager getInstance()
        Returns:
        a shared instance of DiscoveryManager.

      • addListener

        public void addListener(DiscoveryManagerListener listener)
        It is not necessary to set this listener property unless you are implementing your own device picker. Connect SDK provides a default DevicePicker which acts as a DiscoveryManagerListener, and should work for most cases. If you have provided a capabilityFilters array, the listener will only receive update messages for ConnectableDevices which satisfy at least one of the CapabilityFilters. If no capabilityFilters array is provided, the listener will receive update messages for all ConnectableDevice objects that are discovered.
        Parameters:
        listener - Listener which should receive discovery updates

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(DiscoveryManagerListener listener)
        Removes a previously added listener
        Parameters:
        listener - Listener which should be removed

        public void setCapabilityFilters(CapabilityFilter... capabilityFilters)

        Returns:
        the list of capability filters.

      • deviceIsCompatible

        public boolean deviceIsCompatible(ConnectableDevice device)

      • registerDefaultDeviceTypes

        public void registerDefaultDeviceTypes()
        Registers a commonly-used set of DeviceServices with DiscoveryManager. This method will be called on first call of startDiscovery if no DeviceServices have been registered. - CastDiscoveryProvider + CastService - SSDPDiscoveryProvider + DIALService + DLNAService (limited to LG TVs, currently) + NetcastTVService + RokuService + WebOSTVService + MultiScreenService - ZeroconfDiscoveryProvider + AirPlayService

      • registerDeviceService

        public void registerDeviceService(Class<? extends DeviceService> deviceClass,
                                  Class<? extends DiscoveryProvider> discoveryClass)
        Registers a DeviceService with DiscoveryManager and tells it which DiscoveryProvider to use to find it. Each DeviceService has a JSONObject of discovery parameters that its DiscoveryProvider will use to find it.
        Parameters:
        deviceClass - Class for object that should be instantiated when DeviceService is found
        discoveryClass - Class for object that should discover this DeviceService. If a DiscoveryProvider of this class already exists, then the existing DiscoveryProvider will be used.

      • unregisterDeviceService

        public void unregisterDeviceService(Class<?> deviceClass,
                                    Class<?> discoveryClass)
        Unregisters a DeviceService with DiscoveryManager. If no other DeviceServices are set to being discovered with the associated DiscoveryProvider, then that DiscoveryProvider instance will be stopped and shut down.
        Parameters:
        deviceClass - Class for DeviceService that should no longer be discovered
        discoveryClass - Class for DiscoveryProvider that is discovering DeviceServices of deviceClass type

      • start

        public void start()
        Start scanning for devices on the local network.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop scanning for devices.

      • setConnectableDeviceStore

        public void setConnectableDeviceStore(ConnectableDeviceStore connectableDeviceStore)
        ConnectableDeviceStore is a protocol which may be implemented as needed. A default implementation, DefaultConnectableDeviceStore, exists for convenience and will be used if no other device store is provided. In order to satisfy user privacy concerns, you should provide a UI element in your app which exposes the ConnectableDeviceStore removeAll method. To disable the ConnectableDeviceStore capabilities of Connect SDK, set this value to nil. This may be done at the time of instantiation with `DiscoveryManager.init(context, null);`.
        Parameters:
        connectableDeviceStore - ConnectableDeviceStore object which loads & stores references to all discovered devices. Pairing codes/keys, SSL certificates, recent access times, etc are kept in the device store.

      • getConnectableDeviceStore

        public ConnectableDeviceStore getConnectableDeviceStore()
        ConnectableDeviceStore is a protocol which may be implemented as needed. A default implementation, DefaultConnectableDeviceStore, exists for convenience and will be used if no other device store is provided. In order to satisfy user privacy concerns, you should provide a UI element in your app which exposes the ConnectableDeviceStore removeAll method. To disable the ConnectableDeviceStore capabilities of Connect SDK, set this value to nil. This may be done at the time of instantiation with `DiscoveryManager.init(context, null);`.
        Returns:
        ConnectableDeviceStore object which loads & stores references to all discovered devices. Pairing codes/keys, SSL certificates, recent access times, etc are kept in the device store.

      • getAllDevices

        public Map<String,ConnectableDevice> getAllDevices()
        Returns:
        List of all devices discovered by DiscoveryManager. Each ConnectableDevice object is keyed against its current IP address.

      • getCompatibleDevices

        public Map<String,ConnectableDevice> getCompatibleDevices()
        Returns:
        Filtered list of discovered ConnectableDevices, limited to devices that match at least one of the CapabilityFilters in the capabilityFilters array. Each ConnectableDevice object is keyed against its current IP address.

      • getPairingLevel

        public DiscoveryManager.PairingLevel getPairingLevel()
        The pairingLevel property determines whether capabilities that require pairing (such as entering a PIN) will be available. If pairingLevel is set to ConnectableDevicePairingLevelOn, ConnectableDevices that require pairing will prompt the user to pair when connecting to the ConnectableDevice. If pairingLevel is set to ConnectableDevicePairingLevelOff (the default), connecting to the device will avoid requiring pairing if possible but some capabilities may not be available.
        Returns:
        the pairing level

      • setPairingLevel

        public void setPairingLevel(DiscoveryManager.PairingLevel pairingLevel)
        The pairingLevel property determines whether capabilities that require pairing (such as entering a PIN) will be available. If pairingLevel is set to ConnectableDevicePairingLevelOn, ConnectableDevices that require pairing will prompt the user to pair when connecting to the ConnectableDevice. If pairingLevel is set to ConnectableDevicePairingLevelOff (the default), connecting to the device will avoid requiring pairing if possible but some capabilities may not be available.
        Parameters:
        pairingLevel - the pairing level

      • onCapabilityUpdated

        public void onCapabilityUpdated(ConnectableDevice device,
                                List<String> added,
                                List<String> removed)
        Description copied from interface: ConnectableDeviceListener
        When a ConnectableDevice finds & loses DeviceServices, that ConnectableDevice will experience a change in its collective capabilities list. When such a change occurs, this message will be sent with arrays of capabilities that were added & removed. This message will allow you to decide when to stop/start interacting with a ConnectableDevice, based off of its supported capabilities.
        Specified by:
        onCapabilityUpdated in interface ConnectableDeviceListener
        Parameters:
        device - ConnectableDevice that has experienced a change in capabilities
        added - capabilities that are new to the ConnectableDevice
        removed - capabilities that the ConnectableDevice has lost

      • onConnectionFailed

                               ServiceCommandError error)
        Description copied from interface: ConnectableDeviceListener
        This method is called when the connection to the ConnectableDevice has failed.
        Specified by:
        onConnectionFailed in interface ConnectableDeviceListener
        Parameters:
        device - ConnectableDevice that has failed to connect
        error - ServiceCommandError with a description of the failure

      • onPairingRequired

        public void onPairingRequired(ConnectableDevice device,
                              DeviceService service,
                              DeviceService.PairingType pairingType)
        Description copied from interface: ConnectableDeviceListener
        DeviceService listener proxy method. This method is called when a DeviceService tries to connect and finds out that it requires pairing information from the user.
        Specified by:
        onPairingRequired in interface ConnectableDeviceListener
        Parameters:
        device - ConnectableDevice containing the DeviceService
        service - DeviceService that requires pairing
        pairingType - DeviceServicePairingType that the DeviceService requires

      • onServiceAdded

        public void onServiceAdded(DiscoveryProvider provider,
                           ServiceDescription serviceDescription)
        Description copied from interface: DiscoveryProviderListener
        This method is called when the DiscoveryProvider discovers a service that matches one of its DeviceService filters. The ServiceDescription is created and passed to the listener (which should be the DiscoveryManager). The ServiceDescription is used to create a DeviceService, which is then attached to a ConnectableDevice object.
        Specified by:
        onServiceAdded in interface DiscoveryProviderListener
        Parameters:
        provider - DiscoveryProvider that found the service
        serviceDescription - ServiceDescription of the service that was found

      • onServiceRemoved

        public void onServiceRemoved(DiscoveryProvider provider,
                             ServiceDescription serviceDescription)
        Description copied from interface: DiscoveryProviderListener
        This method is called when the DiscoveryProvider's internal mechanism loses reference to a service that matches one of its DeviceService filters.
        Specified by:
        onServiceRemoved in interface DiscoveryProviderListener
        Parameters:
        provider - DiscoveryProvider that lost the service
        serviceDescription - ServiceDescription of the service that was lost
